sentence.text: It respires anaerobically , by a process known as fermentation ; breaking down sugars to produce carbon dioxide and alcohol .
The superintendent slid out of the car and tried to rub the tiredness from her eyes , respiring the chill of the night like an elixir .
He had always respired his work with the same primal need that his body sought oxygen .
It is when an outgoing fish ceases to swim with the shoal and skulks , perhaps with fins folded and respiring more rapidly than usual , that something is suspect .
This assists the corals in the building of their skeletons , and releases oxygen which helps the corals respire .

They respire at lower levels of light , temperature and tissue moisture than bryophytes or vascular plants , and are protected by dehydration against exhaustion of carbohydrate reserves ( Smith , 1984 ) .
Terrestrial amphibians respire through their skin and to do this must keep it moist with mucus .
The first living things evolved in its absence , and many organisms even today still respire without its aid .
Blufton respired deeply , his eyes glued first to the superintendent 's face and then Dexter 's .
Blanche respired steadily to allow the tension to subside and asked Lancaster why David Parkin might want to murder his wife .
However , after dark the plants and algae stop producing oxygen and instead use it to respire .
Because the cornea is avascular , it needs to respire directly from the atmosphere .
In this process , the tentacles serve another and important function , for the water brings with it dissolved oxygen which Lingula needs in order to respire .
David respired slowly , letting the air swell in his lungs before the weight of his rib-cage forced it out .
However , many modern organisms respire without the aid of oxygen ; that is , are anaerobic .
David respired deeply to quieten his euphoria .
